page.title: 01Ardross area - general
page.content: Our area is in the Northern Highlands of Scotland. It is very rich fertile farming land surrounded by forestry and mountain ranges to the North and West. Ardross is situated about 30 miles North of Inverness off the A836. It is a small scattered community consisting of small farms and a few houses. Easter Ardross and Mains are the largest farms in the Ardross area. Glaick is the only croft. Ardross itself has about 19 houses. The countryside around is used for grazing cattle and sheep, for crops, silage and forestry. Large areas of forestry are found around Loch Dubh. North of Ardross and East of Loch Dubh is an ancient burial chamber which is situated in a silage field: it is now only a few stones. Glaick stands on the side of a hill to the East of the
